docs.snippet: A new proposal would prohibit carriers from using money from a federal fund to buy gear from companies deemed national security risks.

headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Joins Push to Limit China’s Telecom Reach

docs.snippet: Rex Tillerson has all but vanished from the State Department's website as his unceremonious firing by tweet took effect over the weekend.

docs.snippet: The head of the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau asked Congress on Monday to trim the agency's power to write rules and spend money.

docs.snippet: Four Marines were killed when their helicopter crashed while they were practicing desert landings in Southern California, the Miramar air station in San Diego said Wednesday.

headline.main: 4 Marines Killed in Helicopter Crash in California

docs.snippet: The U.S. State Department expressed concern on Tuesday at the Malaysian parliament's approval of a bill that would allow prison terms of up to six years for spreading "fake news" - an expression frequently used by U.S. President Donald Trump.

headline.print_headline: U.S. State Department Concerned by Malaysia's 'Fake News' Bill
headline.main: U.S. State Department Concerned by Malaysia's 'Fake News' Bill

docs.snippet: Senior Chinese diplomat Wang Yi told North Korea's foreign minister on Tuesday that Beijing supports the North's planned summits with South Korea and the United States.

headline.print_headline: China Tells N. Korea Official Beijing Supports Its US Summit
